intro: Alcea hohenackeri var. zagrosica, commonly known as the Zagros hollyhock, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Zagros Mountains in Iran. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, rose-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers range in color from pink to red, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
